briefTitle: A New Pharmacotherapy for Alcohol Dependence: Olanzapine

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 21-55 years of age with
* Alcohol Dependence

Exclusion Criteria:

* Medical Contraindications

outcomeMeasures.title: Drinks Per Drinking Day
outcomeMeasures.description: Drinks are measured as the number of standard alcoholic beverages consumed each day, assessed in varying lengths of time (i.e., 2 weeks, 4 weeks, 6 weeks, etc.). A standard alcoholic beverage is equivalent to: 1, 12 oz. regular beer; 1, 5 oz. glass of wine; 1, mixed drink with one1.5 oz shot; or 1, 1.5 oz shot. A drinking day is measured as any day of the week in which an alcoholic beverage is consumed. Data for drinks per drinking day is gathered using the "Time Line Follow Back" method in which participants are asked to recall their alcohol consumption day by day for a pre-defined set of time.
